data.title: Framed Portrait Miniatures of Napoléon Bonaparte, his Mother (Maria Letizia Ramolino), and his Seven Siblings (Caroline Murat, Joseph, Pauline Borghese, Lucien, Louis, Elisa Baciocchi, and Jérôme)
data.text:
On View

Not currently on view

Artist

Unknown (after Delaroche, Füry, Penel, Renue, Remier, Roubure, Teomier[?], Vellier, Veriser[?])

(German, early 19th century)

Title

Framed Portrait Miniatures of Napoléon Bonaparte, his Mother (Maria Letizia Ramolino), and his Seven Siblings (Caroline Murat, Joseph, Pauline Borghese, Lucien, Louis, Elisa Baciocchi, and Jérôme)

Date

1806-1812

Medium

Watercolor on ivory mounted in ivory, shell, and metal frame

Credit

Gift of Dr. Andrew Laurie Stangel

Accession No.

2013.38a-j

Classification

Paintings

Geography

Germany

Related

ca. 1945, purchased in Germany by Charles S. White; by descent to his nephew Andrew Laurie Stangel (Manchester, NH); 2010/2013, gifted by Dr. Andrew Laurie Stangel (Manchester, NH) to the Chazen Museum of Art (Madison, WI)

The Chazen Museum of Art welcomes comments or inquiries about works in our collection. Please allow two–three weeks for a response. Chazen staff is not able to provide valuations or authentications and such inquiries cannot be answered.
